text: when I travel I like to stay in hostels
most of the time because it's a great
way to meet other travelers and it's
almost it's like a community it's like
almost like living in someone's house
it's really cool and you can cook your
own food because there's usually a
kitchen and a little lounging area so I
am staying at the hai hostel in San
Diego at Point Loma I really like it
here because as soon as I came in I
really liked the vibe I was diggin it
and I think that's really important when
choosing a place to stay if you're
looking for affordable accommodations
and want to be relatively close to the
beach outside of the hustle and bustle
of the city yet not too far away from
the action then hi hostel in Point Loma
is for you there are 58 available beds
including dorm style and private there's
a large kitchen friendly staff several
lounging areas laundry services and even
free pancake breakfasts hustling
international has over 4,000 hostels in
over 90 countries around the world and
after my first experience in San Diego
I'm definitely booking with them again
on my next trip have you been to any of
the high hostels let us know where and
how your experience was in the comment
box below happy travels
